articles.title: Midterm voter turnout hasn't topped 50% in more than a century. Will it this year?
articles.description: In the past century, the highest midterm turnout the country has seen was 48.7% in 1966. Larry Sabato, director of the University of Virginia Center for Politics, spoke to CBSN about whether 2018 might be different.

articles.title: House candidate Rashida Tlaib looks to make history in the midterms
articles.description: Rashida Tlaib is on the verge of making history as she runs unopposed as the Democratic nominee for Michigan's 13th Congressional district. CBSN's Reena Ninan spoke to Tlaib, who would be one of the first Muslim women elected to Congress.

articles.title: Rep. John Lewis dances to "Happy" at campaign event in Georgia

articles.title: Football player stuns crowd with national anthem performance
articles.description: Before Jackson Dean Nicholson took to the football field with his high school team, he performed the national anthem. His country rendition stunned the crowd, and went viral. CBS News' Jan Crawford reports.

articles.title: NAACP defends mother charged in death of son swept away in floodwaters

articles.title: Oceans warming faster than previously thought, study finds
